abstract: One occupational hazard of testing skin-care products is overdosing on irritants. The Samurai's next mission: skin restoration.
snippet: One occupational hazard of testing skin-care products is overdosing on irritants. The Samurai's next mission: skin restoration.
lead_paragraph: Ouch. My face hurts. I know, it's killing you too - oldest joke in the book. But it's no joke: one occupational hazard of testing skin-care products is overdosing on irritants. Chemicals can get under your skin, and even natural substances - essential oils, for example - can wreak havoc: lavender's aroma can be therapeutic and calming, but don't ply your face with lavender oil. Ditto minty or citrusy oils and anything acidic, unless buried in a gentle formula. Hypoallergenics can also be problematic. Many contain potential endocrine disrupters and other nasty components. Besides, allergies are as varied as fingerprints; there's no one-size-fits-all solution to irritated skin.
